description: Old form of burden. Compare similar development in murder.

entries.meaning: (obsolete or historical, nautical) The tonnage of a ship based on the number of tuns of wine that it could carry in its holds.

examples: Nor less, I trust,To them I may have owed another gift,Of aspect more sublime; that blessed mood,In which the burthen of the mystery,In which the heavy and the weary weightOf all this unintelligible world,Is lightened:

verbs.description: burthen (third-person singular simple present burthens, present participle burthening, simple past and past participle burthened)
